text.section:
Except as provided in subsection (b) of this section and notwithstanding any power vested in the Authority by this subtitle, the Authority may not make any expenditure until:
The Maryland Historical Trust approves a management plan for the Heritage Area;
The management plan has been adopted by the Authority;
The Mayor and City Council of the City of Cumberland:
Adopt the management plan through formal amendment of the City's comprehensive plan; and
Enact an ordinance that:
The Authority and the Mayor and City Council of the City of Cumberland execute a memorandum of agreement that specifies detailed policies and procedures for mutual notification and review and consultation regarding their respective actions and undertakings in the Heritage Area.

Before the requirements of subsection (a) of this section occur, the Authority may make expenditures only to:
Support the basic administrative operations of the Authority;
Develop the management plan for the Heritage Area and related preliminary plans; and
Acquire complete or partial interests in, or preserve or assist in the preservation of, properties within the park corridor that:
Are listed on or determined to be eligible for listing on the Maryland Register of Historic Properties; and
Would be subject to demolition or major alteration in a manner that is inconsistent with the purposes of this subtitle, unless acquired, preserved, or assisted by the Authority.
